meanings.definition: A group of viruses that enter the body through the gastrointestinal tract and can cause various infections.
meanings.sent1: Enteroviruses can lead to different illnesses when they enter the body through the gut.
meanings.sent2: Doctors study enteroviruses to understand how they cause infections in the body.
meanings.sent3: The enteroviruses decided to throw a party in the stomach, causing chaos.
meanings.sent4: Like tiny invaders, enteroviruses sneak into the body through the gut.
meanings.sent5: The image of enteroviruses entering the body through the gut is quite alarming.

meanings.definition: Enteroviruses are typically transmitted through contact with infected respiratory secretions or fecal matter.
meanings.sent1: When someone sneezes, enteroviruses can spread through the air.
meanings.sent2: People should wash their hands to prevent the spread of enteroviruses from fecal matter.
meanings.sent3: The enteroviruses hitched a ride on a sneeze, traveling from one person to another.
meanings.sent4: In crowded places, enteroviruses can pass from person to person like a game of tag.
meanings.sent5: The thought of enteroviruses moving from one person to another is quite concerning.
